c74object.name: fl.source~
c74object.digest: Captures audio from the host environment and outputs the most recent values as frames
c74object.description: The size of captured frames is settable with the length parameter. The length of the internal buffer determines the maximum frame length. There is a minimum latency equivalent to the length of the captured frame. A longer delay can be optionally selected (subject to the frame and buffer length). Capture can optionally be interpolated (at greater CPU usage) for sub-sample accuracy.

entry.name: /buffer_size [instantiation double]
entry.description: Sets the internal buffer size in the units specified by the units parameter.

entry.name: /length [int]
entry.description: Sets the length of output frames in the units specified by the units parameter.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - samples [1] - ms [2] - seconds
Sets the time units used to determine the buffer size and output length.

entry.name: /delay [double]
entry.description: Sets the input delay in the units specified by the units parameter. Note that a minimum delay (or latency) is applied of the output length.

entry.name: /interp [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - none [1] - linear [2] - hermite [3] - bspline [4] - lagrange
Sets the interpolation mode:
none - no interpolation.
linear - linear interpolation.
hermite - cubic hermite interpolation.
bspline - cubic bspline interpolation.
lagrange - cubic lagrange interpolation.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.source~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: process
method.description:
Process a non-realtime network,advancing time by the number of samples specified by the required length argument.
This will only take effect if the object has its rt attribute set to 0 More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets a non-realtime network to the start of time ready for processing, optionally setting the sample rate. If the sample rate is omitted it will be set to the global sample rate.
This will only take effect if fl.source~ has its rt attribute set to 0. More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: buffer
attribute.description:
Sets the non-realtime buffer~ for fl.source~. This is the buffer~ used for IO in a non-realtime setting.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.source~. When set to 0 fl.source~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.source~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
